page.title: GalaxyTrader MK3
page.t: When enabled, pilots gain experience from trading and require training at certain levels.
Automatically sends pilots for training when they reach required levels.
Adjusts how fast pilots gain experience.
Minimum profit margin required for trades to be cached.
Controls how many notifications are shown: 0=Quiet, 1=Important only, 2=All
Automatically sends ships for repairs. Only for pilots level 12+. S/M → Equipment Dock, L/XL → Shipyard.
Hull percentage for auto-repair trigger. Default: 95%.
Minimum pilot level for auto-repair. Default: 12.
Maximum relative price for sell offers (ship buys FROM stations). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: 0.5 (50% above average). Higher = more expensive but more options.
Minimum relative price for buy offers (ship sells TO stations). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: -0.5 (50% below average). Lower = cheaper buyers but more options.
Sell price max for isolated ships (stuck in single sector). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: 0.5.
Buy price min for isolated ships (stuck in single sector). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: -0.5.
Maximum percentage ROI drop from cached value before rejecting trade. Example: 20% cached ROI with 15% tolerance accepts down to 17% ROI (14% drop).
Automatically blacklist all sectors owned by enemy factions (relation checkbox in blacklist)

Minimum threat level (1-5) required to blacklist a sector:
2=Medium (single attack)
3=Medium-High (hostile factions)
4=High (capital ships/missiles)
5=Very High (Xenon/Khaak)
Manually recreate the threat avoidance blacklist (useful if it was deleted)
Advanced trading system with XP progression and fleet coordination
Choose home sector or station where trader operates
Maximum jump gate distance when buying wares (limited by pilot skill)
Maximum jump gate distance when selling wares (limited by pilot skill)
Automatic selection of suitable wares based on category
Manual selection of specific trading wares
Allow trading in contraband and illegal goods
Security tolerance: 0.0=Only safe sectors, 1.0=Accept all risks
Improve pilot skills through trading experience
Automatically send pilots for training when needed
Coordinate multiple trading ships to avoid conflicts
Target cargo utilization percentage before prioritizing sales
How often market data and price information is updated
Share profitable trade routes with fleet (cached for quick access)
Minimum profit required to cache trade and share with fleet
Maximum profit decline allowed before cached trade routes become invalid
How long cached trade routes remain valid before expiring
Enable detailed logging of individual trade evaluations and rejections (can be very verbose)
Enable per-trade logbook entries and immersive training messages (TaterTrader style)
%s needs training! Please send to nearest shipyard or trading station.
%s has completed training and is now certified for level %s!
%s has completed a trade! Profit: %s Cr
%s has found a profitable trade route!
No profitable trade routes available for %s
Queuing trade order for %1 %2. Buying at %3 to sell at %4. Should earn %5 profit.
Trade completed successfully for %1 %2. Total profit: %3 Credits.
Trade route cached: %1 %2 from %3 to %4 (Profit: %5 Cr)
\nEstimated total lifetime profit before this trade: %1 Cr.

Hello Commander %1,

I've gained enough experience to take my certification exam for the "%2" title. The exam will take approximately %3 minutes at %4.

This is an important milestone in my career development. The exam will test my knowledge of advanced trading protocols, market analysis, and fleet coordination procedures.

I'm confident in my abilities and excited to prove I'm worthy of this advancement. Wish me luck!

Respectfully,
%5
Aboard %6

Commander %1,

Excellent news! I've successfully completed my certification exam and earned the "%2" title!

The exam covered advanced trading strategies, risk assessment protocols, and fleet coordination procedures. I'm pleased to report that I passed with distinction.

I'm now qualified to handle more complex trading operations and look forward to contributing even more to our fleet's success. Thank you for investing in my professional development.

With renewed dedication,
%3
Certified %2
Aboard %4

Commander %1,

I regret to inform you that my certification exam was interrupted due to operational requirements. I'll need to reschedule when circumstances permit.

I remain committed to advancing my skills and will notify you when I can resume the exam process.

Respectfully,
%2
Aboard %3

Commander %1,

I'm currently en route to %2 for my certification exam. The journey gives me time to review my studies and mentally prepare for this important step in my career.

Expected arrival: %3 minutes
Exam duration: %4 minutes

I appreciate your confidence in my abilities and the opportunity for advancement.

With determination,
%5
Aboard %6

Commander,

I've detected cargo in my hold during my systems check. Before I can begin normal trading operations, I need to sell this merchandise.

I'm using our trade search to find the best buyer and safely offload this cargo. Once my hold is clear, I'll proceed with automated trading.

Status: Searching for optimal sale location

With diligence,
Aboard %1

Commander,

My hull integrity has dropped to %1%% (threshold: %2%%). As a Level %3 pilot, I'm authorized to request auto-repair services.

I'm proceeding to %4 for repair work. The estimated cost is %5 Cr, which is within our budget.

Once repairs are complete, I'll resume trading operations with full structural integrity.

Respectfully,
Aboard %6

Commander,

URGENT FINANCIAL WARNING

My hull integrity is critical at %1%% (threshold: %2%%), but our available funds (%3 Cr) are insufficient for full repairs (estimated cost: %4 Cr).

I'm proceeding to %5 for PARTIAL REPAIRS using our available funds. This isn't an ideal solution, but it's necessary to maintain operational capability.

Please consider allocating additional funds for future maintenance operations.

Concerned but determined,
Aboard %6

Commander,

My Level %1 certification authorizes automatic resupply of defensive equipment. After checking my systems, I've determined that my countermeasures and deployables are below recommended thresholds.

I'm proceeding to %2 to restock my defensive equipment:
• Countermeasures: Replenishing to optimal capacity
• Defense drones, trade drones, laser towers: Applying balance profile

This resupply ensures I'm best protected against space threats while maintaining trading efficiency.

With vigilance,
Aboard %3

Commander,

My hull integrity has dropped to %1%% (threshold: %2%%), and I need repair services. However, the nearest repair station at %3 is currently unreachable due to sector travel restrictions (blacklisted routes).

I will continue with trading operations despite this limitation. Once safe routes become available again, I will automatically seek repair services.

I will monitor the situation and notify you when repairs become possible.

Respectfully,
Aboard %4

Commander,

My defensive equipment requires resupply, but the nearest equipment station at %1 is currently unreachable due to sector travel restrictions (blacklisted routes).

I will continue with trading operations despite this limitation. Once safe routes become available again, I will automatically seek resupply services.

I will monitor the situation and notify you when resupply becomes possible.

Respectfully,
Aboard %2

Commander,

I've completed an exhaustive market analysis of %1 and surrounding sectors (within %2 jumps, minimum profit threshold: %3 Cr), but unfortunately found no profitable trading opportunities that meet our requirements.

TRADE ANALYSIS REPORT:
Total opportunities evaluated: %4

REJECTION BREAKDOWN:
- Docking restrictions: %5 trades
 (Station doesn't permit my ship class)
- Insufficient profitability: %6 trades
 (Below minimum profit threshold)
- Insufficient volume: %7 trades
 (Zero or negative tradeable amount)
- Safety restrictions: %8 trades
 (Blacklisted stations or dangerous sectors)

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Consider adjusting profit thresholds
- Expand maximum trading distance
- Review sector blacklist settings
- Wait for market conditions to improve

I'll continue monitoring the market and will notify you when profitable opportunities become available.

Standing by,
Aboard your service

Commander,

URGENT ROUTE ALERT

My threat intelligence system has detected that sector %1 (threat level %2) is now in my planned trade route. For the safety of the ship and crew, I am immediately aborting the current trade operation.

ACTIONS TAKEN:
- All trade orders cancelled
- Returning to safe operations mode
- Will find alternative trade route that avoids dangerous sectors
- Cargo handling: Automatic (will sell any cargo at safe location if needed)

The dynamic blacklist system will prevent future trades through this sector until the threat is cleared.

Safety is my first priority.

With vigilance,
Aboard %3

Commander,

ESCAPE ROUTE INITIATED

I'm currently in blacklisted sector %1 and have found a trade route that will allow me to escape safely.

TRADE ROUTE:
Buy: %2 (Sector: %3)
Sell: %4 (Sector: %5)
Ware: %6 (x%7)
Expected Profit: %8 Cr

The ship will escape the blacklisted sector after completing this trade.

Respectfully,
Aboard your service

Commander,

ISOLATED TRADING MODE

I'm currently in sector %2, but all routes to other sectors are blocked by blacklisted hub sectors. This means I can only trade within my current sector until the blacklist situation changes.

SITUATION:
Current Sector: %2
Status: Isolated (non-blacklisted sector with blocked routes)
Trading Mode: Intra-sector trades only

My trading system has automatically adjusted profit thresholds to prioritize available intra-sector trading opportunities.

I will continue monitoring the situation and notify you if routes become available again.

Respectfully,
Aboard %1

Commander,

ROUTE PATH CHANGE DETECTED

Upon entering sector %1, my navigation system detected that the route to my destination %2 (%3) has changed.

PATH ANALYSIS:
- Normal distance: %4 jumps
- Blacklist-aware distance: %5
- Status: %6

My navigation computer indicates that the preferred route is no longer viable due to sector travel restrictions. For the safety of the ship and crew, I am immediately aborting the current trade operation.

ACTIONS TAKEN:
- All trade orders cancelled
- Returning to safe operations mode
- Will find alternative trade route that avoids blocked sectors
- Cargo handling: Automatic (will sell any cargo at safe location if needed)

My navigation system will automatically avoid blocked sectors in future route planning.

Safety is my first priority.

With vigilance,
Aboard %7
It is an honor to work for you, %1! I am excited to begin my trading career under your command. I will do my best to serve you well and contribute to your success.

Thank you for giving me this well-deserved holiday, %1! I have enjoyed my time away from trading and my skills remain intact. I am looking forward to returning to work whenever you need me. Until then, I will keep my trading knowledge sharp!
I am back from holiday and ready to work again, %1! My trading skills remain sharp and I am eager to continue serving you on %2. Thank you for the well-deserved rest!

Thank you for my transfer to %1, %2! I am honored by this new assignment and will take excellent care of my new ship. My trading experience and skills remain intact, and I am ready to continue serving you.
Fleet coordination: %s has been assigned route %s
Fleet coordination: Route %s is fully utilized
%s has been assigned as primary territory for %s
Territory bonus applied: %s%% profit increase in %s
Error: %s is stuck and needs assistance!
Error: Cannot register %s with GalaxyTrader MK3
Master toggle for all debug_text output. When disabled, all debug logging is suppressed. When enabled, debug messages appear in the DebugLog based on individual debug_text chance values.

Resets all profit statistics to 0 for all pilots and ships. Use this after upgrading to v0.6.0 to clear inflated revenue-based statistics. The fix now tracks actual PROFIT (revenue - purchase cost). Trade counts and XP are preserved.
Delay between batches during trade search processing (1-100ms). Higher values reduce CPU load but slow down trade searches. Default: 50ms. Used in batch processor and trade list filtering.
Delay between trade validations in AI script (1-100ms). Higher values reduce CPU load but slow down trade validation. Default: 50ms. Used when validating trade list from MD system.

Maximum number of trade searches that can run simultaneously (1-10). Lower values reduce CPU load but increase queue wait times. Higher values process searches faster but may cause performance spikes. Default: 1.
Level 6+ traders detect hostile ships and avoid dangerous routes. Disable to stop all scans (improves performance). Risk tolerance per-ship in command behavior settings (scale 0-10).
Only flag factions with relation equal to or lower than this value as threats. Default: -20%
Automatically blacklist dangerous sectors (threat level 3+) to force ships to route around threats. Uses vanilla navigation for alternate routes.
Trade Masters (Level 15) will auto-resupply defensive equipment after trades. Applied at commander level for subordinates.
All ships (S/M/L/XL). Separate capacity. Critical for missile defense.
L/XL ships only. Shares unified capacity with other deployables.
L/XL ships only. Essential for trading operations. Shares unified capacity.
All ships. L/XL ships share unified capacity, S/M use cargo.
L/XL ships only. Works with auto-repair system. Shares unified capacity.
Resupply when countermeasures fall below this percentage (all ships, separate capacity).
Resupply when total deployables fall below this percentage (L/XL ships: drones + towers share one capacity).

Unified capacity distribution (L/XL ships): Trading-Focused (20/50/20/10), Balanced (35/35/20/10), Defensive (50/20/20/10), Heavy Defense (40/30/20/10), Tower Support (30/30/30/10). Ratios: Defense/Trade/Towers/Repair. Click to cycle options.
Show XP values in ship names
Enable or disable automatic ship renaming with pilot information
Show rank titles in ship names
Show level numbers in ship names
Show trading status in ship names
Choose the source for ship base names: Model Name (with variant), Type Name (generic), or Base Name (without variant)
Show ship class (S, M, L, XL) in ship names
GalaxyTrader fleet management and pilot statistics
View and manage all GalaxyTrader pilots
Click to sort by Ship ID
Click to sort by Pilot Name
Click to sort by Ship Type
Click to sort by Lifetime Profit
Refresh pilot data from mission system
Export current view to CSV file
Create pilots by assigning ships to GalaxyTrader, or wait for data to load.
